thread.title: Throwback Thursday: The suitcase you’ve been missing
thread.title_full: Throwback Thursday: The suitcase you’ve been missing

author: Kristin Jackson
title: Throwback Thursday: The suitcase you’ve been missing
text:
Throwback Thursday: The suitcase you’ve been missing Originally published July 2, 2015 at 9:16 am Updated July 2, 2015 at 10:06 am Harry Bell of Seattle demonstrated “The Traveler’s Companion,” his combination suitcase / table / ironing board back in 1984. (AP) Suitcase unfolds to become a table and an ironing board. It’s this week’s vintage travel photo. Seattle Times NWTraveler editor 
Now here’s a suitcase with a difference. 
Harry A. Bell of Seattle designed what he hoped the world was waiting for — a suitcase that unfolds to become a table and an ironing board. 
Bell posed with what he called “The Traveler’s Companion ” (which he patented ) back in 1984 at what looks like an Aurora motel. 
It’s our Throwback Thursday travel photo of the week. But history doesn’t record what happened to Mr. Bell and his Traveler’s Companion. Anyone know? Most Read Stories
